page.title: 10Farming In South Kyme-2
page.content: Work starts at 7.30am, packed lunch eaten at 11am, and home for 4.15pm, for a cooked meal. In busy times workers go back to work until stopped by dark or weather. Farms vary in size from 10 to over 900 acres. Fields are large, flat and well drained. Some crop spraying is done by aeroplane.Straw is bailed or chopped, but much is still burnt. The land is then ploughed or cultivated immediately & fertilizer spread. Autumn drilling, potato and sugar beet lifting make this a busy time of year. {FARM PRICES:Land-around Â£2,000per acre New corn store - Â£65 per tonne stored. Potato Store - Â£120 per tonne stored. Tractors:135hp -Â£26,000, 90hp -Â£16,000 Plough - Â£3,800, Combine - Â£40,000 Yields(per acre):Wheat-3tonnes @ Â£140 per tonne, Potatoes-15 tonnes @ Â£65 per tonne. Oilseed Rape-Â£290 per tonne
